title: torch.cat: Unclear error message when concatenating Tensor with Variable
body_html:
When concatenating Tensor type with Variable, torch.cat fails because of type incompatibility. However, the error message is not clear on the cause of the error. It would be helpful to explicitly show that concatenation of Tensor with Variable type is not allowed.

x = torch.randn(2, 2)
y = Variable(torch.randn(2, 2))
torch.cat((x, y), 0)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple, int), but expected one of:
 * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
 * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple, int)
body_text:

body:
When concatenating Tensor type with Variable, torch.cat fails because of type incompatibility. However, the error message is not clear on the cause of the error. It would be helpful to explicitly show that concatenation of Tensor with Variable type is not allowed.

```python
x = torch.randn(2, 2)
y = Variable(torch.randn(2, 2))
torch.cat((x, y), 0)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple, int), but expected one of:
 * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
 * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple, int)
```
